contract (and it's further calls), it is necessary to prepare the | external reward architecture in a way where the system bytecode has a hardcoded value of where the external contract call | is performed to. | | theoretically, this step could also be utilized to do other system calls in a daemon-like fashion, so I've added an external | interface step to allow this as well. | | there is also code so the administration of the node can be made discrete from the reward output, as in the case of an owner->financial manager, owner->technical manager hierarchical structure of ultimate node address"}},"getExternalContractReward()":{"details":"Returns the extended rewards set within this block reward contract.","returns":{"result":"extended rewards set within this block reward administrator access permanently.","returns":{"result":"   | true = administrator permanently removed    | false = not administrator"}},"setBenefactorCoinbase(address,address)":{"details":"Sets the Benefactor's Coinbase (reward destination). This is either set by the benefactor (block author) initially, or by the benefactor's administration delegate.","params":{"_benefactorAddress":"The benefactor addresses that will be consistently referenced (the administration key of the block author/sealer).","_coinbaseAddress":"The Coinbase (reward destination) address from Shyft tokens from the inflation, as equivalent barter payment for node services ex. uptime."},"returns":{"result":"   | 1 = set benefactor's coinbase    | 0 = message sender not able to set benefactor's coinbase"}},"setBenefactorDelegate(address,address)":{"details":"Sets the Benefactor's Delegate (administration proxy). This is initially set by the benefactor's keys, and allows the delegate control over the Coinbase (reward) address for this benefactor (block sealer).","params":{"_benefactorAddress":"The benefactor addresses that will be consistently referenced (the administration key of the block author/sealer).","_delegateAddress":"The Delegate address that will now determine on-chain administrative concerns (setting a benefactor's Coinbase, etc.)"},"returns":{"result":"   | 3 = set benefactor's delegate    | 2 = delegate is already assigned to a benefactor    | 1 = benefactor not recognized as a sealer, so no action taken.    | 0 = message sender not able to set benefactor's coinbase"}},"setExAdministrator(address)":{"details":"| Sets the Administrator address for the extended functions:      | i. remove: removal of administrator access permanently.      | ii. rewards: set whether rewards should be given to the extended contract      | iii. calls: set whether an extended call sequence should be given to the extended contract      | iii. the smart contract address of the extended contract to distribute to","params":{"_administratorAddress":"The new Administrator address for the extended functions."},"returns":{"result":"   | true = administrator set    | false = administrator already set"}},"setExCallsEnabled(bool)":{"details":"| Sets whether an extended call sequence should be given to the extended contract. These calls are      | explicitly called by the system itself, which currently does *not* propagate any events to the system.","params":{"_exCallsEnabled":"Whether an extended call sequence should be given to the extended contract."},"returns":{"result":"   | true = ex calls set    | false = not administrator"}},"setExContractAddress(address)":{"details":"Sets the smart contract address of the extended contract to distribute to","params":{"_exContractAddress":"The new extended contract address for block rewards & potential calls (if enabled)"},"returns":{"result":"   | true = ex contract address set    | false = not administrator"}},"setExRewardsEnabled(bool)":{"details":"Sets whether rewards should be given to the extended contract (block rewards)","params":{"_exRewardsEnabled":"Whether the extended contract rewards should be enabled."},"returns":{"result":"   | true = ex rewards set    | false = not administrator"}}},"stateVariables":{"administratorAddress":{"details":"The administrator's address for any of the extended contract updates."},"benefactorCoinbase":{"details":"A Mapping for block author Coinbase(s), if set to anything other than the benefactor address."},"benefactorDelegate":{"details":"A Mapping for block author Delegates."},"blockSealerHistoryArray":{"details":"A Mapping for block sealer array."},"blockSealerHistoryLastBlockSealedMapping":{"details":"A Mapping for block sealer last block sealed."},"blockSealerHistoryMapping":{"details":"A Mapping for block sealer history."},"delegateOriginalBenefactor":{"details":"A Mapping for block author Delegates."},"emptyStepReward":{"details":"The empty step (block sealed but no tx) reward."},"exCallsEnabled":{"details":"Whether the extended contract's calls are enabled."},"exContractAddress":{"details":"What the extended contract's address is."},"exRewardsEnabled":{"details":"Whether the extended contract's rewards are enabled (required to 'call' as well)."},"externalReward":{"details":"The external reward (to an external contract)."},"externalRewardStep":{"details":"The external reward step (or \"kind\")"},"lockExAdministrator":{"details":"Whether the administrator's access has been locked."},"runtimeInflationReward":{"details":"The runtime inflation reward."},"sealerReward":{"details":"The block sealer reward."},"sealerRewardStep":{"details":"The block author (sealer) step (or \"kind\")"},"stakingPoolReward":{"details":"The staking pool reward."},"stepValues":{"details":"The values for the specific steps (or \"kinds\") in the reward process."},"systemAddress":{"details":"The System address (the protocol's address)."},"uncleReward":{"details":"The uncle reward. 0 since POA Aura."}},"version":1},"userdoc":{"events":{"EVT_logExCall(address,bool,bool,address,bytes)":{"notice":"| All of the logs below are *only for debug & further development purposes* - The \"system\" cannot         | currently output event logs, but these will work fine for truffle testing purposes."}},"kind":"user","methods":{"constructor":{"notice":"The systemAddress *must* be set as such for the reward() function to trigger properly."},"reward(address[],uint16[])":{"notice":"| the administrator can also purposefully make it such that the settings of whether there are external | block rewards and/or updates to the external contract address, cannot be further modified by the administrator | (total removal of capability/responsibility for managing this contract)"},"setExCallsEnabled(bool)":{"notice":"| Enabling these calls without proper audit and due diligence can result in the entire block reward contract         | being disabled, so measures exist to halt this within this contract (if not explicitly disabled), set up a new receiver contract connection, and then re-enabled system features."},"setupExData(bool,bool,address)":{"notice":"this function primarily exists to perform all action in a single step."}},"notice":"| this contract cannot be updated, but there are mechanisms in place to allow for the extended contract to update itself without | a requirement for administrators in the future; there are flexibility mechanisms on both sides to allow for a proper consensus on | how to treat this in a fair fashion.","version":1}},"settings":{"compilationTarget":{"project:/contracts/ProtocolBlockReward/ShyftBlockReward.sol":"ShyftBlockReward"},"evmVersion":"istanbul","libraries":{},"metadata":{"bytecodeHash":"ipfs"},"optimizer":{"enabled":true,"runs":200},"remappings":[]},"sources":{"project:/contracts/Interfaces/IBlockReward.sol":{"keccak256":"0x2226e672a1299257868ef189ac1e5aec094b365f7df4e0a05350e34cc8ff9fab","license":"UNLICENSED","urls":["bzz-raw://6dd0b3c3759c4b0a0938476ccaf63bf729aa4d276f469a81500e22c835cd74c5","dweb:/ipfs/QmXz3zMd6uNLYLCJ9QCsumTgonDJDtioVfVPDZENAB4D6T"]},"project:/contracts/Interfaces/IBlockRewardDistributor.sol":{"keccak256":"0x8c512b82882180708ff453d3b3226c5a482cbb57f26c7c65bab9eac6f99648c5","license":"UNLICENSED","urls":["bzz-raw://d6db19013ae7e5b05982954a579a85e29d7b7cfb419b1a6cd7559f37eaf5c432","dweb:/ipfs/QmfFYH3dFvXxLibJjBiLDLXUYDyBoBzJnFW7YsZENnzUpN"]},"project:/contracts/Interfaces/IBlockRewardUpdater.sol":{"keccak256":"0x4565db370a5515f01517da736f915fd9aaed5ebeb31e9d9da774d6aeba93b7a7","license":"UNLICENSED","urls":["bzz-raw://ab1bec7618830386884ecc689e3fb3beca44c661e6000e03cb75981638403db6","dweb:/ipfs/QmUhC7Zrg49tkHjwC2QACGz1proCNmeVNx2JfyE1bZ4Lu5"]},"project:/contracts/Interfaces/IShyftBlockRewardAdministration.sol":{"keccak256":"0x82c932f755619c8b4fade395b52d92599087cbbb1d5a732b5482a8f61143ae52","license":"UNLICENSED","urls":["bzz-raw://a643756f5fd2d48d4da10f3c32020523cdf6138ab048ce702e79a1eb8e443039","dweb:/ipfs/QmT7vmJEMTcxiLZteaNhUV9zAtHY77wP3dra9x63zUmtHN"]},"project:/contracts/ProtocolBlockReward/ShyftBlockReward.sol":{"keccak256":"0x34bbcef17653a3107425941d5e4df513b349df06d911c8c2589efc2ee0dfdea8","license":"UNLICENSED","urls":["bzz-raw://20c7bb84e4f360eef143b12461d0227ff232a29f5a7a3128ab5e888c5f482390","dweb:/ipfs/Qmaqc24ystbdJ5qBh8D4d7Dvd25yUH9c1DXDcwDUVfA6um"]}},"version":1}

documentation.text:
@dev |
 | shyft inflation per month: 12,600,000
 | there is network security inflation (4,200,000)
 | there is network runtime community dao inflation (4,200,000)
 | there is byfrost staking pool inflation (4,200,000)
 |
 | the external reward (runtime + staking) is sent as an "external" to another contract which is then executed in this step.
 |
 | because there is no capability to emit events from this contract (and it's further calls), it is necessary to prepare the
 | external reward architecture in a way where the system bytecode has a hardcoded value of where the external contract call
 | is performed to.
 |
 | theoretically, this step could also be utilized to do other system calls in a daemon-like fashion, so I've added an external
 | interface step to allow this as well.
 |
 | there is also code so the administration of the node can be made discrete from the reward output, as in the case of an owner->financial manager, owner->technical manager hierarchical structure of ultimate node administration.
 @notice
 | this contract cannot be updated, but there are mechanisms in place to allow for the extended contract to update itself without
 | a requirement for administrators in the future; there are flexibility mechanisms on both sides to allow for a proper consensus on
 | how to treat this in a fair fashion.
@dev Event for clearing a Delegate's Benefactor (so that the key can be used again as a delegate).
@dev Event for changing extended rewards processing status.
@dev Event for removing the extended administrator for this contract permanently (current settings are set forever).
@dev Event for changing the extended administrator.
@dev Event for changing the extended interface calls.
@dev Event for changing the extended interface contract address.
@dev Event for changing of the Delegate for a specific Benefactor (block author/sealer).
@dev Event for changing the Coinbase for a specific Benefactor (block author/sealer).
@dev Event for logging a call event for the extended contract.
@dev Event for logging a call event for the extended contract.
@dev Event for logging a call event for the extended contract.
@dev The System address (the protocol's address).
@dev The runtime inflation reward.
@dev The staking pool reward.
@dev The block sealer reward.
@dev The empty step (block sealed but no tx) reward.
@dev The external reward (to an external contract).
@dev The uncle reward. 0 since POA Aura.
@dev The block author (sealer) step (or "kind")
@dev The external reward step (or "kind")
@dev The values for the specific steps (or "kinds") in the reward process.
@dev The administrator's address for any of the extended contract updates.
@dev Whether the administrator's access has been locked.
@dev Whether the extended contract's rewards are enabled (required to 'call' as well).
@dev Whether the extended contract's calls are enabled.
@dev What the extended contract's address is.
@dev A Mapping for block author Coinbase(s), if set to anything other than the benefactor address.
@dev A Mapping for block author Delegates.
@dev A Mapping for block author Delegates.
@dev A Mapping for block sealer last block sealed.
@dev A Mapping for block sealer history.
@dev A Mapping for block sealer array.
@dev Modifier for the function call to only ever be able to be called by the system.

@dev Creates the contract, inputs the system address, and creates some tables.
 @notice The systemAddress *must* be set as such for the reward() function to trigger properly.

@dev Returns the System address
 @return result the system address
@notice this function primarily exists to perform all action in a single step.

@notice
 | the administrator can also purposefully make it such that the settings of whether there are external
 | block rewards and/or updates to the external contract address, cannot be further modified by the administrator
 | (total removal of capability/responsibility for managing this contract)

@dev Returns the extended contract address.
 @return result extended contract address

@dev Returns the extended rewards set within this block reward contract.
 @return result extended rewards set within this block reward contract

@dev Gets all of the block sealers that have sealed blocks on the blockchain network.
 @return result all of the block sealers that have sealed blocks on the blockchain network.

attributes.text:
@dev |
 | shyft inflation per month: 12,600,000
 | there is network security inflation (4,200,000)
 | there is network runtime community dao inflation (4,200,000)
 | there is byfrost staking pool inflation (4,200,000)
 |
 | the external reward (runtime + staking) is sent as an "external" to another contract which is then executed in this step.
 |
 | because there is no capability to emit events from this contract (and it's further calls), it is necessary to prepare the
 | external reward architecture in a way where the system bytecode has a hardcoded value of where the external contract call
 | is performed to.
 |
 | theoretically, this step could also be utilized to do other system calls in a daemon-like fashion, so I've added an external
 | interface step to allow this as well.
 |
 | there is also code so the administration of the node can be made discrete from the reward output, as in the case of an owner->financial manager, owner->technical manager hierarchical structure of ultimate node administration.
 @notice
 | this contract cannot be updated, but there are mechanisms in place to allow for the extended contract to update itself without
 | a requirement for administrators in the future; there are flexibility mechanisms on both sides to allow for a proper consensus on
 | how to treat this in a fair fashion.
@dev Event for clearing a Delegate's Benefactor (so that the key can be used again as a delegate).
@dev Event for changing extended rewards processing status.
@dev Event for removing the extended administrator for this contract permanently (current settings are set forever).
@dev Event for changing the extended administrator.
@dev Event for changing the extended interface calls.
@dev Event for changing the extended interface contract address.
@dev Event for changing of the Delegate for a specific Benefactor (block author/sealer).
@dev Event for changing the Coinbase for a specific Benefactor (block author/sealer).
@dev Event for logging a call event for the extended contract.
@dev Event for logging a call event for the extended contract.
@dev Event for logging a call event for the extended contract.
@dev The System address (the protocol's address).
@dev The runtime inflation reward.
@dev The staking pool reward.
@dev The block sealer reward.
@dev The empty step (block sealed but no tx) reward.
@dev The external reward (to an external contract).
@dev The uncle reward. 0 since POA Aura.
@dev The block author (sealer) step (or "kind")
@dev The external reward step (or "kind")
@dev The values for the specific steps (or "kinds") in the reward process.
@dev The administrator's address for any of the extended contract updates.
@dev Whether the administrator's access has been locked.
@dev Whether the extended contract's rewards are enabled (required to 'call' as well).
@dev Whether the extended contract's calls are enabled.
@dev What the extended contract's address is.
@dev A Mapping for block author Coinbase(s), if set to anything other than the benefactor address.
@dev A Mapping for block author Delegates.
@dev A Mapping for block author Delegates.
@dev A Mapping for block sealer last block sealed.
@dev A Mapping for block sealer history.
@dev A Mapping for block sealer array.
@dev Modifier for the function call to only ever be able to be called by the system.

@dev Creates the contract, inputs the system address, and creates some tables.
 @notice The systemAddress *must* be set as such for the reward() function to trigger properly.

@dev Returns the System address
 @return result the system address
@notice this function primarily exists to perform all action in a single step.

@notice
 | the administrator can also purposefully make it such that the settings of whether there are external
 | block rewards and/or updates to the external contract address, cannot be further modified by the administrator
 | (total removal of capability/responsibility for managing this contract)

@dev Returns the extended contract address.
 @return result extended contract address

@dev Returns the extended rewards set within this block reward contract.
 @return result extended rewards set within this block reward contract

@dev Gets all of the block sealers that have sealed blocks on the blockchain network.
 @return result all of the block sealers that have sealed blocks on the blockchain network.

devdoc.details: | | shyft inflation per month: 12,600,000 | there is network security inflation (4,200,000) | there is network runtime community dao inflation (4,200,000) | there is byfrost staking pool inflation (4,200,000) | | the external reward (runtime + staking) is sent as an "external" to another contract which is then executed in this step. | | because there is no capability to emit events from this contract (and it's further calls), it is necessary to prepare the | external reward architecture in a way where the system bytecode has a hardcoded value of where the external contract call | is performed to. | | theoretically, this step could also be utilized to do other system calls in a daemon-like fashion, so I've added an external | interface step to allow this as well. | | there is also code so the administration of the node can be made discrete from the reward output, as in the case of an owner->financial manager, owner->technical manager hierarchical structure of ultimate node administration.

EVT_clearedDelegateBenefactor(address).details: Event for clearing a Delegate's Benefactor (so that the key can be used again as a delegate).

EVT_logExCallPreUpdateBenefactor(address.details: Event for logging a call event for the extended contract.

EVT_logExCallUpdateBenefactor(bool,addre.details: Event for logging a call event for the extended contract.

EVT_removeExAdministratorPermanently().details: Event for removing the extended administrator for this contract permanently (current settings are set forever).

EVT_setExAdministrator(address).details: Event for changing the extended administrator.

EVT_setExCallsEnabled(bool).details: Event for changing the extended interface calls.

EVT_setExContractAddress(address).details: Event for changing the extended interface contract address.

EVT_setExRewardsEnabled(bool).details: Event for changing extended rewards processing status.

constructor.details: Creates the contract, inputs the system address, and creates some tables.

params._benefactorAddress: The benefactor addresses that will be consistently referenced (the administration key of the block author/sealer).
The benefactor addresses that will be consistently referenced (the administration key of the block author/sealer).

getBlockSealerHistoricallyExists(address.details: Gets whether a specific block Sealer has ever sealed a block.

returns.result: whether the block sealer has ever sealed a block

getBlockSealerLastBlock(address).details: Gets the last time a specific block Sealer has sealed a block.

returns.result: the last time the block sealer has ever sealed a block

getDelegatedBenefactorAddress(address).details: Gets the Delegate's original Benefactor address.

getExternalContractReward().details: Returns the extended rewards set within this block reward contract.

returns.result: extended rewards set within this block reward contract

getHistoricalBlockSealers().details: Gets all of the block sealers that have sealed blocks on the blockchain network.

returns.result: all of the block sealers that have sealed blocks on the blockchain network.
| true = administrator permanently removed    | false = not administrator

setBenefactorCoinbase(address,address).details: Sets the Benefactor's Coinbase (reward destination). This is either set by the benefactor (block author) initially, or by the benefactor's administration delegate.

params._benefactorAddress: The benefactor addresses that will be consistently referenced (the administration key of the block author/sealer).
params._coinbaseAddress: The Coinbase (reward destination) address from Shyft tokens from the inflation, as equivalent barter payment for node services ex. uptime.

returns.result: | 1 = set benefactor's coinbase    | 0 = message sender not able to set benefactor's coinbase

setBenefactorDelegate(address,address).details: Sets the Benefactor's Delegate (administration proxy). This is initially set by the benefactor's keys, and allows the delegate control over the Coinbase (reward) address for this benefactor (block sealer).

params._benefactorAddress: The benefactor addresses that will be consistently referenced (the administration key of the block author/sealer).
params._delegateAddress: The Delegate address that will now determine on-chain administrative concerns (setting a benefactor's Coinbase, etc.)

returns.result: | 3 = set benefactor's delegate    | 2 = delegate is already assigned to a benefactor    | 1 = benefactor not recognized as a sealer, so no action taken.    | 0 = message sender not able to set benefactor's coinbase

setExAdministrator(address).details: | Sets the Administrator address for the extended functions:      | i. remove: removal of administrator access permanently.      | ii. rewards: set whether rewards should be given to the extended contract      | iii. calls: set whether an extended call sequence should be given to the extended contract      | iii. the smart contract address of the extended contract to distribute to

params._administratorAddress: The new Administrator address for the extended functions.

returns.result: | true = administrator set    | false = administrator already set

setExCallsEnabled(bool).details: | Sets whether an extended call sequence should be given to the extended contract. These calls are      | explicitly called by the system itself, which currently does *not* propagate any events to the system.

params._exCallsEnabled: Whether an extended call sequence should be given to the extended contract.

returns.result: | true = ex calls set    | false = not administrator

setExContractAddress(address).details: Sets the smart contract address of the extended contract to distribute to

params._exContractAddress: The new extended contract address for block rewards & potential calls (if enabled)

returns.result: | true = ex contract address set    | false = not administrator

setExRewardsEnabled(bool).details: Sets whether rewards should be given to the extended contract (block rewards)

params._exRewardsEnabled: Whether the extended contract rewards should be enabled.

returns.result: | true = ex rewards set    | false = not administrator

administratorAddress.details: The administrator's address for any of the extended contract updates.

benefactorCoinbase.details: A Mapping for block author Coinbase(s), if set to anything other than the benefactor address.

benefactorDelegate.details: A Mapping for block author Delegates.

blockSealerHistoryArray.details: A Mapping for block sealer array.

blockSealerHistoryLastBlockSealedMapping.details: A Mapping for block sealer last block sealed.

blockSealerHistoryMapping.details: A Mapping for block sealer history.

delegateOriginalBenefactor.details: A Mapping for block author Delegates.

emptyStepReward.details: The empty step (block sealed but no tx) reward.

exCallsEnabled.details: Whether the extended contract's calls are enabled.

exContractAddress.details: What the extended contract's address is.

exRewardsEnabled.details: Whether the extended contract's rewards are enabled (required to 'call' as well).

externalReward.details: The external reward (to an external contract).

lockExAdministrator.details: Whether the administrator's access has been locked.

stepValues.details: The values for the specific steps (or "kinds") in the reward process.

uncleReward.details: The uncle reward. 0 since POA Aura.

EVT_logExCall(address,bool,bool,address,.notice: | All of the logs below are *only for debug & further development purposes* - The "system" cannot         | currently output event logs, but these will work fine for truffle testing purposes.

constructor.notice: The systemAddress *must* be set as such for the reward() function to trigger properly.

reward(address[],uint16[]).notice: | the administrator can also purposefully make it such that the settings of whether there are external | block rewards and/or updates to the external contract address, cannot be further modified by the administrator | (total removal of capability/responsibility for managing this contract)

setExCallsEnabled(bool).notice: | Enabling these calls without proper audit and due diligence can result in the entire block reward contract         | being disabled, so measures exist to halt this within this contract (if not explicitly disabled), set up a new receiver contract connection, and then re-enabled system features.

setupExData(bool,bool,address).notice: this function primarily exists to perform all action in a single step.

userdoc.notice: | this contract cannot be updated, but there are mechanisms in place to allow for the extended contract to update itself without | a requirement for administrators in the future; there are flexibility mechanisms on both sides to allow for a proper consensus on | how to treat this in a fair fashion.
